description: '''''Choro''''' ({{IPA|pt|ˈʃoɾu}}, "cry" or "lament"), also popularly called '''''chorinho''''' ("little cry" or "little lament"), is an instrumental [[Music of Brazil|Brazilian popular music]] genre which originated in 19th century [[Rio de Janeiro]]. Despite its [[wikt:choro#Noun 3|name]], the music often has a fast and happy rhythm. It is characterized by virtuosity, improvisation and subtle [[Modulation (music)|modulations]], and is full of [[syncopation]] and [[counterpoint]]. Choro is considered the first characteristically Brazilian genre of urban popular music. The [[Street performance|serenader]]s who play choros are known as '''''chorões'''''.
